questions.question: Why would absolute monarchs claim divine right?

choices.answer: to justify their authority to rule
to seize the lands of feudal nobles
to satisfy the demands of religious leaders
to ensure the good of the people

questions.question: What kingdom did Charles V rule over?

choices.answer: England
France
Spain
Hapsburg Empire

questions.question: How did Charles V divide up his empire after his abdication of the throne?

choices.answer: Central Europe went to his son. The rest became independent.
Central Europe went to his brother. The rest went to his son
Central Europe became independent. The rest went to his son.
Central Europe went to his son. Muslims invaded the rest

questions.question: How did Philip II influence the art of Spain's golden age?

choices.answer: He provided financial support to artists.
He was skilled at drawing and painting.
He ruled that all art depict religious subjects.
He gave work only to Spanish-born artists.

questions.question: What was one way that Henry IV reunited France?

choices.answer: by becoming Protestant
by joining the Huguenots
by becoming Catholic
by expelling the Huguenots

questions.question: What new dynasty emerged to rule France?

choices.answer: Hapsburgs
Tudors
Bonapartes
Bourbons

questions.question: What happened on St. Bartholomew's Day?

choices.answer: French Huguenots were granted tolerance
massacre of thousands of Huguenots at a royal wedding
English fleet defeated the Spanish Armada
Christian crusaders captured the city of Jerusalem

questions.question: What was the symbol of King Louis XIV?

choices.answer: the rose
the sun
a hammer and sickle
a crescent moon

questions.question: What did Prussia possess that made it a great power?

choices.answer: a disciplined army
a unified theocracy
a strong alliance with Austria
a robust free market economy

questions.question: Why did Peter the Great strengthen serfdom in Russia?

choices.answer: to punish people who opposed him
to help pay for his reforms
to follow the example of Western Europe
to win the support of the boyars

questions.question: Which is an example of Peter the Great's legacy?

choices.answer: He created a more democratic monarchy.
He expanded Russian territory.
He established Russia's first warm-waterx port.
He put an end to all serfdom.

questions.question: How did Catherine succeed where Peter the Great had failed?

choices.answer: She strengthened the insitute of serfdom.
She expanded Russia's borders.
She won a warm-water port for Russia.
She introduced policies to westernize Russia.

questions.question: What were the two main rivalries after 1750?

choices.answer: England and Austria; France and Prussia
England and France; Austria and Prussia
England and Prussia; France and Austria
England and Russia; France and Austria

questions.question: What territorial changes resulted from the Peace of Westphalia, ending the Thirty Years' War?

choices.answer: The Holy Roman Empire was united under a single ruler.
Spain separated from the Hapsburg empire.
Netherlands & Swiss Confederation became independent states.
The German states became Protestant.

questions.question: What was the main reason Elizabeth I worked with Parliament?

choices.answer: She needed to raise funds.
She rejected the notion of divine right.
She wanted Parliament to approve her royal marriage.
She wanted to be popular with her subjects.

questions.question: Which of the following was a provision of the Petition of Right?

choices.answer: Parliament had the right to appoint the king's successors.
The king could not marry without Parliament's permission.
The king couldn't levy taxes without Parliament's permission
Catholics had the right to practice their religion freely.

questions.question: Which of the following was a significant result of the Glorious Revolution?

choices.answer: English kings lost all their power.
The theaters were reopened in England.
Parliament accepted the divine right of kings.
England became a limited monarchy.

questions.question: Thinkers of the Enlightenment sought to use natural law to

choices.answer: solve social problems.
find cures for major diseases.
explain the workings of the solar system.
create lasting works of art.

questions.question: Which of the following best matches the work of John Locke?

choices.answer: wrote The Leviathan; absolute monarchy
wrote Two Treatises of Government; limited government
wrote The Spirit of the Laws; separation of powers
wrote The Social Contract; minimal government controls

questions.question: Which of the following best matches the work of Jean-Jacques Rousseau?

choices.answer: wrote The Leviathan; absolute monarchy
wrote Two Treatises of Government; limited government
wrote The Spirit of the Laws; separation of powers
wrote The Social Contract; minimal government controls

questions.question: Which of the following best matches the work of Montesquieu?

choices.answer: wrote The Leviathan; absolute monarchy
wrote Two Treatises of Government; limited government
wrote The Spirit of the Laws; separation of powers
wrote The Social Contract; minimal government controls

questions.question: Which of the following best matches the work of Thomas Hobbes?

choices.answer: wrote The Leviathan; absolute monarchy
wrote Two Treatises of Government; limited government
wrote The Spirit of the Laws; separation of powers
wrote The Social Contract; minimal government controls

questions.question: Adam Smith favored an economic system in which

choices.answer: the government played an active role in the economy
the government played no role in the economy.
prices were determined by supply and demand.
business put the public good ahead of the desire for profit.

questions.question: The purpose of the Navigation Acts was to

choices.answer: build a global trading network.
regulate colonial trade.
increase the size of the British navy.
assert British control over the slave trade.

questions.question: Why was the Battle of Saratoga a turning point in the American Revolution?

choices.answer: It forced the British to surrender, ending the war.
It was a major setback that forced the Americans to retreat
convinced the Continental Congress to declare independence.
persuaded other nations to ally with the American colonists.

questions.question: Who made up the Third Estate in the ancien régime?

choices.answer: the French monarch, King Louis XVI
the clergy
the titled nobility
the boureoisie and rural peasants

questions.question: Which of the following was the opening act of the French Revolution?

choices.answer: the execution of King Louis XVI
King Louis XVI convening the Estates-General
the ratification of the Constitution of 1791
the storming of the Bastille

questions.question: Which type of government did the Constitution of 1791 establish?

choices.answer: a limited monarchy
a totalitarian system
a republic
an absolute monarchy

questions.question: In 1972, how did France change under the National Convention?

choices.answer: The French countryside dissolved into violence.
Order and peace were restored in Paris.
France became a republic.
France became a constitutional monarchy.

questions.question: Name one example of social reform during the French Revolution.

choices.answer: New religious schools were built.
The military was disbanded.
Slavery was abolished in France's colonies.
The ancien regime was strengthened.
